title: Unbrewed dylibs/header files/.pc files for macFUSE
body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Unbrewed dylibs were found in /usr/local/lib.
If you didn't put them there on purpose they could cause problems when
building Homebrew formulae and may need to be deleted.

Unexpected dylibs:
  /usr/local/lib/libfuse3.4.dylib

Warning: Unbrewed header files were found in /usr/local/include.
If you didn't put them there on purpose they could cause problems when
building Homebrew formulae and may need to be deleted.

Unexpected header files:
  /usr/local/include/fuse3/*

Warning: Unbrewed '.pc' files were found in /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig.
If you didn't put them there on purpose they could cause problems when
building Homebrew formulae and may need to be deleted.

Unexpected '.pc' files:
  /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/fuse3.pc
```

### Verification

- [x] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.4.26
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew.git
HEAD: f1041842141f20bc701b522d4371d7843d905580
Last commit: 6 days ago
Branch: stable
Core tap JSON: 30 Mar 11:47 UTC
Core cask tap JSON: 30 Mar 11:47 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /usr/local
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: vim
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
HOMEBREW_NO_ANALYTICS: set
Homebrew Ruby: 3.3.7 => /usr/local/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/3.3.7/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit westmere
Clang: 16.0.0 build 1600
Git: 2.49.0 => /usr/local/bin/git
Curl: 8.7.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 15.3.2-x86_64
CLT: 16.2.0.0.1.1733547573
Xcode: 16.2
Rosetta 2: true
```

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

> brew doctor

### What happened (include all command output)?

Unbrewed dylibs/header files/.pc files for macFUSE seems detected by error.

> /usr/local/lib/libfuse3.4.dylib
> /usr/local/include/fuse3/*
> /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/fuse3.pc

All of those files are required for libfuse3 support. I'm not sure how Homebrew tracks which files belong to a cask, but those files are installed by macFUSE since version 4.10.0 and are required by macFUSE. Removing them will break certain file systems.

This looks more like a Homebrew issue to me than a macFUSE issue. Please raise the issue with the maintainer of the macFUSE Homebrew cask.

### What did you expect to happen?

`Your system is ready to brew` should be displayed.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
- Install Homebrew
- brew doctor (should say: Your system is ready to brew)
- Install macFUSE (https://macfuse.github.io)
- brew doctor (you will reproduce the issue)

Please refer to https://github.com/macfuse/macfuse/issues/1063.
cc @subfighter3
```
